description:
About the job

Overview




A leading global financial institution is seeking an experienced SQL Developer to join its Dublin technology team. The successful candidate will work on high-availability data platforms supporting trading, risk, compliance, and regulatory reporting functions. This role involves complex data transformation, optimisation, and collaboration with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced enterprise environment.




Key Responsibilities




Design, develop, and optimise complex SQL queries, stored procedures, functions, and ETL processes across large financial datasets.
Support and enhance enterprise data solutions.
Work closely with business stakeholders to gather and refine data requirements.
Create robust data validation frameworks and ensure data quality across critical systems.
Optimise database performance, indexing strategies, and query execution plans.
Collaborate with application developers, analysts, and data engineers on end-to-end project delivery.
Assist in the migration and modernisation of legacy database systems where required.
Provide production support for high-priority financial systems when needed.




Required Skills & Experience

Hands-on SQL development experience (T-SQL, PL/SQL, or equivalent).
Proven ability working with large, complex datasets in an enterprise or financial environment.
Strong experience with RDBMS technologies such as SQL Server, Oracle, or PostgreSQL.
Excellent understanding of query optimisation, indexing, performance tuning.
Experience with ETL tools 
Strong understanding of data governance and security standards in regulated environments.
Excellent analytical, communication, and problem-solving skills.




This is a daily rate contract role involving three days per week on site.

About the job

Senior Python Engineer 

6 month Contract (Cork, Ireland)




Key Requirements (Mandatory):

6+ years of hands-on Python software development experience
Strong expertise in core Python (mandatory)
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field

Technologies – Must Have:

Python

Technologies – Preferred:

Databases: SQL / NoSQL
FastAPI, RESTful APIs
Git, Docker, Linux

Experience:

Minimum 6+ years of overall software engineering experience

About the job

Searching for a strong SQL Developer to join a key client within the financial services industry and play a puvotal role in the development of their large scale, enterprise systems 




*6 month contract expected to roll/extend 

*3 days per week onsite 

*Daily Rate 450-600 depending on experience




Requirements: 

5+ years of industry experience developing software
Strong background with SQL (2019 and above) and SQL Server
Experience with JIRA, GIT etc
Experience with stored procedures, complex querying, performance tuning 




If this sounds of interest please apply today or reach out to Rebecca Lavery at IT Search for more details

About the job

Product Engineer | Mobile-First | React Native | TypeScript | Tech for Good | Remote (Europe)




Are you a Product Engineer who wants to build software with a positive real-world impact? 🌱




Are you the sort of person who enjoys working end-to-end on meaningful products, rather than just shipping tickets?




If so, this could be a great opportunity for you ...




I am currently partnered with a Tech for Good startup whose mission is simple but powerful: helping people get outdoors and reconnect with nature through technology 🌍




Their mobile-first product has grown rapidly over the past few years and is now used by hundreds of thousands of people across 170+ countries, earning multiple global App of the Day features along the way ⭐




With the product entering its next phase of growth, they’re now looking to bring in another Product Engineer to join a small, high-performing team and help shape what comes next. This is a genuinely hands-on role, with a strong focus on user experience, delivery quality, and product thinking.




This is not a role for someone who wants to stay in a narrow lane. You’ll be encouraged to think holistically about the product, collaborate closely with engineering, product and design, and take real ownership over what you build and why you build it.




What you’ll be doing

Building and maintaining a mobile-first product used by a global community
Working end-to-end across the stack, from frontend experience through to backend services
Collaborating closely with product and design to turn ideas into shipped features
Making pragmatic technical decisions with performance, quality and scalability in mind
Contributing to architectural discussions as the platform continues to evolve
Taking ownership of features and driving them from concept through to delivery




What they’re looking for

Senior-level experience with JavaScript / TypeScript
Strong experience with React and React Native
Solid backend experience with Node.js
Experience working with distributed systems or architectures
A strong product mindset and interest in user-centric development
Prior experience working in a product-focused startup or scale-up environment
Someone who cares about impact and is motivated by working on a Tech for Good product




Nice to haves

Experience with Next.js
GraphQL / Apollo
Styling frameworks such as CSS or Tailwind
Pub/Sub or event-driven architectures




Package & benefits

💷 £50,000 – £70,000 base salary
📈 Equity + bonus
🌍 Remote-first working across Europe
🏡 Co-working space allowance
🏖️ 25 days holiday + bank holidays + birthday off
🤝 Regular team gatherings and offsites




If you’re a Product Engineer looking to work on a purpose-led product with a genuinely engaged user base, this is well worth a conversation.




Drop me a message or apply directly to the advert to find out more🌟




Product Engineer | Mobile-First | React Native | TypeScript | Tech for Good | Remote (Europe)
